review: I am very disappointed and considering return ing it.  We have only been able to watch a few episodes on Netflix two nights  in the  two months that I have had it.  We keep getting a message that it is scanning trying to find another network.  That does not happen. I would say I wasted my money.

review: still have not been able to watch 1 single show using this. Have tried on 3 different TV's (2 Visio, 1 black friday Best Buy cheapo POC) Fire TV Stick has tons of network issues and just plain doesn't work. was a complete waste of money

review: It lags a lot and I thought it would be cheaper and easier to install cordlessly to my flat TV on the wall than buying another Roku, but now I wish I would've just spent the extra money.

review: Excellent and easy to set up and use.

review: I'm typically a fan of all things Amazon, but the Fire TV Stick is a mediocre product.  It resets itself, stops, plays audio while the video is frozen and sadly not as stable of streaming video product as my Apple TV.  Three stars for "just ok."
author: David L

review: This Product works amazingly , im very happy with it , im glad I made the move to drop cable service
author: cliffmd

review: Really like it. Prefer it to Chromecast because it offers Amazon Prime Instant Video and Netflix plus so much more. I have also used Roku boxes and prefer Fire TV stick to it as well because of lower price, similar features, yet lower profile. And I definitely prefer it over a smart TV. I would never buy a smart TV again. Fire TV stick, Roku, and Chromecast all work better than our smart TV for Netflix, etc.
author: Carissa

review: Works beautifully even household members with mild hearing loss can hear
author: Marie Carpenter

review: I got my Fire Stick free for signing up for Sling for three months. If I'd paid for it I would want a refund. It cuts off two or three times per day. I figured out you have to unplug the electric cord and plug it back in to get it to work again.  Other than that it's ok. but it's just aggravating when it cuts off. Always at the worst time.
author: Pickle Head

review: I started writing this review while setting up a new FireTV Stick to go in another room of the house. From beginning to end is about 1 hour. It took 25 minutes for me to go from being a happy Amazon customer to one who will probably NEVER buy another Amazon branded electronic device.5 minutes in  -  One star since your instructions say the device is already registered to me since I purchased it here on Amazon with my Amazon Prime Account, but it is not registered and I hate entering secure (aka LONG) passwords in these horrible softkeyboards using a directional button. It was already a pain putting in the long wireless key. Why can't I just type some stupid random code into a browser window to register the device like with Hulu, Netflix or Amazon Prime? I wouldn't have cared as much if you didn't pretend to have a fast trouble free setup.It didn't help that for some reason the screen began to flash green while asking me for my account credentials. Unplugging from the HDMI port and re-inserting seems to have remedied it.It just gets worseOkay...5 minutes later it happened again. A quick Google search shows that this stupid device doesn't work with the Panasonic Plasma (1.5yrs old) in 1080p. Sweet. Where's the hardware compatibility list for this $40 garbage?  Looks like this is going back and I'm buying an AppleTV device or Chromecast. I really hate that you wasted my time with this BS Amazon. The device was going on Sony LED TV but I'm not in the mood to play games with Amazon when they can't seem to work out how HDMI standards work and there is no warning about it not working with certain major brand HDTV displays. What a waste of time. I'm generally an Amazon fanboy but this and a Xmas fiasco with Amazon's tablets is definitely eroding that.50 minutes in - After speed-reading a few forums and Amazon help boards it looks like the pixel orbiter that prevents burnin on Panasonic Plasmas is what the FireTVStick can't handle. It should stop if I disable that, at the expense of possibly damaging my screen on my $2k TV with apps on it to use this $40 device. Still going back. I don't appreciate the negatives before ever getting to use it. Choose another device folks.
author: REO Speed Dragon
